```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
library(readr)
library("ggplot2")
library("ggthemes")

head(shapes)

Shapes_Plot_COTA_Jan2014 <- ggplot(shapes) +
  geom_path(aes(shape_pt_lon, shape_pt_lat, group = shape_id),
            size = .1, alpha = .1) +
  coord_equal() +
  theme_map()

Shapes_Plot_COTA_Jan2014

stops_metro <- stops %>%
  filter(!grepl("", stop_id))

```

```{r}

library(dplyr)
library(tidyverse)
library(readr)
library("ggplot2")
library("ggthemes")
library("leaflet")
library("stringr")


m = leaflet() %>%
  # Add CartoDB background map
  addProviderTiles("CartoDB.DarkMatter") %>%  
  # Add a marker for each stop
  addCircleMarkers(lng= ~ stop_lon, lat= ~stop_lat, data = head(stops,100),
                   stroke = FALSE, fillOpacity = 0.5, radius =5 ) 
m  # Show the map









```

```{r}


url <- 'https://www.cota.com/COTA/media/COTAContent/OpenGTFSData.zip'

COTA_gtfs_obj <- url %>% import_gtfs()
  
map_gtfs(gtfs_obj = COTA_gtfs_obj) # map all routes of agency with stops
    


Central_Ohio_Transit_Authority <- COTA_gtfs_obj[['Central Ohio Transit Authority']]$agency_name[1]
map_gtfs(gtfs_obj = COTA_gtfs_obj, agency_name = Central_Ohio_Transit_Authority, include_stops = FALSE) # map all routes of agency, with no stops
```
